title: Mike Cannon-Brookes in $260 million Atlassian selldown
text:
We are loath to dwell immoderately on the divergent words and actions of billionaire climate warrior Mike Cannon-Brookes, but permit us this one addendum to our observations of yesterday that the Atlassian is expending a very modest effort of his own combating the planet’s degradation while beseeching hefty action of our elected leaders.

What has gone largely unnoticed is that Cannon-Brookes has been selling shares in Atlassian at a cracking pace. While he still holds around 60 million shares in the software unicorn worth $US7.3 billion ($10.9 billion), he has been offloading around $US1.3 million every trading day since February 21. Loot of that magnitude could abate a lot of carbon – or even just buy Lady Mary Fairfax’s mansion on Sydney Harbour.

According to his latest Form 144 lodged with the US Securities and Exchange Commission, Magic Mike has cashed out $US175 million this year. His vastly more bearable co-founder Scott Farquhar has done the same, selling 620,000 Atlassian shares in the three months to August 30. That's $520 million of free cash between them.

Principals’ share trading is more opaque in the United States than in companies listed on the Australian bourse. Little wonder, then, that Cannon-Brookes and other tech Rich Listers like WiseTech Global’s Richard White would like the ASX to adopt the Nasdaq regime. Of course they would.
